properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 3 at 5:20PM CST until January 4 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Quick Round of Snow Through Tonight...

.Light to moderate snow will continue to spread across eastern
Iowa through the evening hours. Narrow bands of heavier snow are
expected to develop which could drop visibilities to a quarter
mile for a brief time and quickly lead to slushy accumulation on
pavement. The heavier bands of snow will make for hazardous travel
conditions and greatly reduced visibilities. Total snow
accumulations are expected to range from 1 to 3 inches.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2
inches with isolated amounts near 3 inches possible. Brief
moderate to heavy bands of snow may drop visibilities down to
a quarter mile at times.

* WHERE...Jones, Cedar and Muscatine Counties.

* WHEN...Until 3 AM CST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and rapid changes
in visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Call 511 for road conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SATURDAY
